title: What is considered a "Troll Pick"
body:
Some people would say, {{champion:16}}  Top. {{champion:85}}  ADC. {{champion:17}}  Jung, would be troll picks.

But if they work, whats the problem? Just had a Raka top destroy a darius, ive done Teemo jungle and just invade the enemy yi and ruin his jungle and make him RQ. So whats the deal? Just because its not meta?

replies.body: You know what is a troll pick? {{champion:48}}  everywhere :))))
The most troll pick is {{champion:17}} Support

I have gotten an S+ with mid soraka and just got an S- (in a lost game) with ADC ahri, but it does not exactly make these effective picks.

They are considered troll picks because A; most league players are young children and are incapable of thinking without meta, and B; they are weak picks that are only going to suceed with an experienced player and in very specific conditions. Most of the times offmeta picks feed.
i pray to god i never see you.
I only do it in blinds, where everyone is an unranked preteen with a skin thinner than evaporated mountain dew, thus nothing of value gets selftilted.

Nothing has a 0% win rate, it's just that soraka top or whatever you're asking statistically has a high chance of losing.  You may win one game but then lose the next 5, it's like playing azir in his intended role. While it's not bad he loses most games even though he's played correctly.  

The back lash comes from people not wanting to place their faith on a 25% chance miss fortune top.
Taking Raka Top diminishes the best part of her kit and  there are far better top lane champs to pick for that role.  That's why Raka top is a troll pick.
